data.title: Memorials – Metropolitan Funeral
data.text:
Regina Michelle Jenkins Blunt

December 8, 1959 - August 7, 2024

Regina Michelle Jenkins-Blunt, a cherished daughter, mother, and friend, passed away peacefully on August 7, 2024. Born on December 8, 1959, in Portsmouth, VA, Regina was the beloved daughter of James Jenkins Jr. and Carrie Jenkins. Regina’s educational journey began in the Portsmouth Public Schools. She attended Woodrow Wilson High School and Deep Creek High School. Continuing her education, Regina graduated from Commonwealth College as a Certified Nursing Assistant. Later, driven by her passion for…...

Read Full Memorial

Hattie V. Diggs

January 30, 1944 - August 3, 2024

With heavy hearts, we announce the passing of our beloved, Hattie Diggs, who peacefully departed from this world on August 3, 2024. Hattie was a pillar of strength, a beacon of love, and a source of boundless wisdom for all who were fortunate enough to know her. Hattie was a former nurse at Virginia Beach Healthcare and Rehabilitation Medical Facility. She dedicated her life to caring for others and making a difference in the lives…...

Read Full Memorial

Neolus Backers

May 3, 1929 - August 5, 2024

“Well done thy good and faithful servant…. Enter thou into the joy of the Lord”. Matthew 25:21 On August 5, 2024, Neolus Backers left us to be with her Heavenly Father. Her 95 years on earth were filled with love and joy for her family and The Lord. Neolus was born on May 3, 1929, in Norfolk, Virginia to the late Susie and Junius Hodges Sr. She was the second oldest of eight children. Neolus…...

Eleanor Juanita Brown

September 13, 1936 - August 4, 2024

Eleanor Batts (Wiliams) Brown entered into eternal rest on August 4th, 2024 in Virginia Beach, VA. Born September 13th, 1936, in Norfolk, VA. She was the eldest daughter of four siblings. She was preceded in death by her Father, James M. Batts, and her Mother Rebecca Brown. Eleanor (aka Peaches) was happily married to James H. Brown for twenty-six years. She is survived by her Husband James H. Brown, son Rodney Pierre Williams, Grandsons Christian…...

Read Full Memorial

Jean Muriel Lawrence Kiah

May 24, 1933 - August 3, 2024

On Saturday, August 03, 2024, Jean Muriel Lawrence Kiah peacefully transitioned to her new home with the Lord. She was the second child born to the late Malachi Ashley Lewis Lawrence and Bessie Oliver Lawrence on May 24, 1933. Jean was raised in a blended family. When she was two years old, her mother passed away, leaving her father and his older children from his first marriage to raise her in the Truxton area of…...

Michael Demorris Ford, Sr.

March 13, 1950 - August 5, 2024

Michael DeMorris Ford Sr., 74, of Suffolk VA, entered eternal rest on August 5th, 2024, amongst his loved ones at Sentara Obici Hospital. He was born on March 13, 1950, in Isle of Wright County, Virginia to the late Floyd Jones, Jr, and the late Helen Ford. Michael attended Westside High School and graduated in 1969. After graduating, Michael pursued a career as an X36 (Rigger) building ships. He retired from Newport News Shipbuilding (Shipyard).…...

Ruby Patrice Midgette

May 24, 1952 - August 4, 2024

Ruby Patrice Midgette took her place with the angels in Heaven on Sunday, August 4, 2024, after surviving cancer for several years. She was born on May 24, 1952, to her late parents, Euzell Gray and Nathaniel Parker. She attended Booker T. Washington High School and went to prom with her high school sweetheart who became her husband of 49 years, Rufus Delano Midgette. She was a faithful member of Angelic Church under the leadership…...

Read Full Memorial

Elsie M. Brown

February 6, 1928 - August 3, 2024

Elsie Maxine Brown passed away peacefully at her home in Virginia Beach, VA, on August 3, 2024. Born on February 6, 1928, in Virginia Beach, VA, she was the beloved daughter of the late Frank and Maud Owens. Elsie dedicated over 35 years as an employee with the city of Virginia Beach. After retiring from Virginia Beach, Elsie could be found enjoying her favorite pastimes, playing Solitaire, catching up on her favorite Soap Operas, and…...

George Foreman, Jr.

October 25, 1952 - August 1, 2024

George Foreman, Jr 71, departed this life on August 1, 2024. He was born to the late George, Sr. and Corine Foreman of Norfolk, Va. He was preceded in death by two sons: George Daquan and George Isaiah; 3 siblings: Elsie Russell, Bobby Foreman, and Cora L. Foreman; and one niece, Wanda Foreman-Gilchrist. George was educated and graduated from Norfolk public schools. George was very talented which led to him acquiring different jobs. He has…...

Beverly Lee Winstead

May 12, 1953 - August 2, 2024

Beverly Lee Winstead, born to Eunice and Marion Winstead on May 12, 1953, transitioned from this life on August 2, 2024, at the age of 71. Beverly was a Norfolk native known for her love of life’s simple pleasures. She enjoyed sharing beers with friends and family, playing dominoes, and catching up on her favorite TV shows. Despite living a humble life, she was always generous, offering what she could to those in need. Her…...

Lamont Bunn

August 24, 1973 - August 1, 2024

Mr. Lamont Bunn transitioned from his early life on August 1, 2024. Lamont was born August 24, 1973 in Chesapeake, VA. The son of Mrs. Georgia Mae Bunn and the late William Bunn, Sr., Lamont was raised in Chesapeake and attended Chesapeake Public Schools. Lamont worked as a Pipelayer, and he loved it with a passion. He followed into the footsteps of his late father. Although Lamont loved his job, he also loved to shop and look good.…...

Rufus Lee Miller

October 24, 1941 - August 1, 2024

Retired Chief Petty Officer, Rufus Lee Miller, affectionately knows as (Bay) was the first of six born on October 24, 1941 to the late Adam Miller Sr and Victoria C. Miller in McIntosh County, GA. He transitioned to his eternal rest on August 1, 2024. Rufus graduated from Todd Grant School in Darien, GA class of 1959. After graduation, he enlisted in the United States Navy and became a Master Chef and was Honorably Discharged…...

Evelyn M. Robinson

November 7, 1952 - August 1, 2024

Evelyn Maxine Robinson was called home on August 1, 2024, at home surrounded by her sons and loved ones. Affectionally called Aunt Evelyn, she was born November 7, 1952, in Norfolk, Virginia to the late Emma Lee Pulley and William Rickman Pulley. Evelyn was a beautiful, loving, and resilient, mother, grandmother, sister, and aunty as well as a wonderful friend who will be greatly missed. Aunt Evelyn was a very hard worker and she loved…...

Shirley Marie Mitchell M. Hales

February 17, 1943 - July 31, 2024

Our Beloved Shirley M. Mitchell Hales (81), of Norfolk Va. left this world but not our hearts. Born February 17, 1943 to Johnny Riddick and Alice Mitchell of Coefield, North Carolina. She departed this life in the breaking of dawn, July 31, 2024. Shirley was preceded in death by her father and mother Johnny Riddick and Alice Mitchell. Her grandmother, Mary Mitchell. Her two sons; Tony Moore (Hannah Patterson) and Tony Ballard and a grandson…...

James Askew III

August 24, 1951 - July 22, 2024

On Friday, August 24, 1951, “Jimmy” was born to the late James Askew Jr. and Vivian Askew-Curry. Monday, July 22, 2024, at 10:44 pm, his heavenly Father granted him entrance into his heavenly home. As a youth “Jimmy” was baptized and became a member of Fourth Baptist Church Portsmouth, VA. After relocating he became a member of New Birth Missionary Baptist Church where he sang in the Male and Total Praise Choir in Stonecrest, GA.…...

Jean Delores Stewart Lewis

June 27, 1939 - July 29, 2024

Jean Delores Stewart-Lewis was called home to be with the Lord on July 29, 2024. She was born June 27, 1939, to the late Albert Sullivan and Catherine Stewart in Portsmouth, Virginia. Jean was predeceased by her brothers Vincent Marsh, Raymond Stewart, and Sister Cecelia Stewart. She was educated in the Portsmouth Public School System and graduated from I.C. Norcom High School, Class of 1958. Jean was employed with the Loomis Security Company and then…...

Overseer Pastor Rosa B. Patterson

October 14, 1939 - July 29, 2024

In the early morning of July 29, 2024, our beloved mother, grandmother, cousin and friend entered into eternal rest with our Lord Jesus Christ. Overseer Pastor Rosa B. Patterson was born on October 14, 1939 in Norfolk County, Virginia to the late Eugene and Ethel Ross. She attended Crestwood High School and participated in choir, a subject that became her passion. At an early age, she joined Mt. Sinai Baptist Church. She was then led…...

Read Full Memorial

Timothy J. Bennett

February 21, 1985 - July 24, 2024

On July 24, 2024, our heavenly father chose to bring his son, Timothy James Bennett, age 39, home to be with him. Timothy was born on February 21, 1985, to Nathaniel Bennett, Sr and Linda Bennett in Washington, DC. Timothy’s life journey was marked by dedication to his education, family, and community. Growing up in Washington, DC, Timothy had many fun and exciting adventures, including being a camp counselor, junior vacation Bible school teacher, Sunday…...

Sharon Elaine Brockman

May 23, 1954 - July 27, 2024

It is with profound sadness that we announce the sudden passing of Sharon Elaine Thorne Brockman, who left us unexpectedly on July 27, 2024 at 8:51 a.m. at the age of 70. She was born May 23, 1954 in Norfolk County to Velma Bonney Mayes and Samuel Lee Newton. Sharon was a beacon of love, kindness, and dedication, leaving behind a legacy that will be cherished forever. For 35 years, Sharon served with unwavering commitment…...

Read Full Memorial

Valerie Denise Faison

August 6, 1957 - July 26, 2024

Valerie Denise (Grandison) Faison, born on August 6, 1957, went home to be with the lord on July 26, 2024, after a short and courageous battle with cancer. Valerie’s beauty, generosity, and infectious laugh left an indelible mark on everyone she met. Originally from Smithfield, Virginia but raised in the Deep Creek area of Chesapeake, Valerie lived a life filled with compassion and warmth. She was known for her generous spirit, always ready to lend…...

Robert Eugene Johnson

March 1, 1948 - July 25, 2024

Robert Eugene Johnson went to his eternal rest to be with the Lord and Savior on July 25, 2024. He was born in Norfolk, Virginia on March 1, 1948, to the late Robert L Johnson and Alease V. Johnson. He was fondly called by family and friends, BJ, Bobby, Dad, Steppie, Pop Pop, Granddad, and Uncle. He attended Norfolk Public Schools and later worked as a Merchant Seaman traveling to many countries around the world…...

Read Full Memorial

Cornelius Jarode Jones

September 25, 1999 - July 4, 2024

Cornelius Jarode Jones, affectionately known as Duke, passed away on July 4, 2024, at the age of 24. He was born to Lawrence Jones Jr. and Gertha Cleveland on September 25, 1999, in Temple, TX. He recently resided in Killeen, TX. Cornelius grew up in a loving and nurturing household with his mother Gertha and stepfather Donnell Hawkins. Donnell never referred to Duke as his stepson, he was always simply his son. From the age…...

Read Full Memorial

Pastor Victoria Garnetta Singletary

May 5, 1967 - July 26, 2024

Pastor Victoria Garnetta Singletary departed this life on Friday, July 26, at 7:00 a.m., after four years of illnesses. She was born in Portsmouth, VA, at the Naval Hospital on May 5, 1967, to the late Deacon Robert E. Matthews and Deaconess Ella J. Matthews. Pastor Singletary graduated from Norview High School and attended Tidewater Community College, where she studied Child Care Development. Victoria’s nurturing nature was evident in her five years of work in…...

Read Full Memorial

Vanessa Lynn Morris

February 24, 1958 - July 24, 2024

On the morning of Saturday, July 27th Vanessa Lynn Morris went home to her Lord. Vanessa filled her 66 years of life with knowledge, stories, wisdom, and fun. Born to Shirley and Irving Smith in Hampton, Virginia, she spent the entirety of her adult life in the Tidewater area. The center of Vanessa’s life was her faith. She was a devout follower of the Lord and spent her life living according to the principles taught…...

Read Full Memorial

Marguerite W. Stinger

July 25, 1938 - July 25, 2024

On Thursday, July 25, 2024, our beloved sister, mother, aunt, grandmother and friend, Marguerite Winfield Stinger (86 years) of Chesapeake, Virginia, answered her heavenly Father’s call. Marguerite was born on July 25, 1938, in Norfolk County known today as Chesapeake, VA to the late Bernice R. and Clarence V. Winfield. Upon graduating from Crestwood High School, Marguerite chose a career in nursing. Marguerite was a concerned, kindhearted, compassionate, resilient person with a sense of humor.…...

Read Full Memorial

Catherine Brittle

October 8, 1955 - July 22, 2024

Catherine Brittle was born October 8, 1955, to the late Christopher C. Brittle and Thelma S. Brittle. She peacefully passed away on July 22, 2024, in her home. Catherine accepted the Lord at an early age and was baptized at Union Bethel Baptist Church. She served as a Jr. usher and a choir member and was a strong believer in Jesus Christ. Catherine enjoyed listening to Christian and R&B music and loved good preaching. She…...

Read Full Memorial

Robert Lee Harrell

October 19, 1940 - July 26, 2024

Robert Lee Harrell, 83, fell asleep in death on July 26, 2024, peacefully at home surrounded by his wife and family. Born to Clara and Albert Harrell in Norfolk, VA on Saturday October 19, 1940. He was a graduate of Booker T. Washington High School, and he attended Tidewater Community College. Robert retired from the City of Norfolk, in May 2003. In 1966 Robert made a life changing decision to serve Jehovah and he became a faithful servant of Jehovah.…...
